intro: Draba yunussovii, commonly known as the Yunussov's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cold, arid conditions. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and produces numerous small, yellowish flowers in the spring. Draba yunussovii is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
